newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's March electrical output rises 3.15 percent.
newsitem.headline: Peru's March electrical output rises 3.15 percent.

text.p: Peru's electrical power output in March rose 3.15 percent to 1,422 gigawatt hours (GWh), compared with the same month last year, the Energy and Mines Ministry said Thursday.
Total electrical power output in the first three months was up 2.07 percent to 4,131 gigawatt hours (GWh), compared to the same period last year.
Public service firms accounted for 1,148 GWh in March, while firms generating their own power produced the remaining 274 GWh of the country's total output.
State-run Electroperu, the largest of Peru's power- generating public service firms, produced 505 GWh in March, down 12 percent from the same month last year.
